result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • James A. Malitz was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  No operation of motor vehicle w/o valid DL.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol.  Absolute Sobriety.

If extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant James A. Malitz in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant James A. Malitz in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Raabe makes correciton of PSI.  Atty. Albrecht makes recommendation and statement of history.   Court imposes sentence.

Paperwork handed in court.
Sentencing hearing on September 9, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant James A. Malitz in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  State states agreement.  Plea to count 1 w/PSI to be requested and sentencing date to be set out.  Atty Raabe agrees and files plea questionaire.  Atty Raabe enters NC plea to Ct 1.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds DE guilty.  Court orders PSI to be completed no later than 9/2/2016.  DE to report to LEC by 11:00 a.m. today pending sentencing.  Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances, not to operate MV w/o valid DL and must submit to testing if requested by law enforcement pending reporting to jail today.

Ct 1:  NC - PSI ordered
Ct 2:  Dismissed  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Plea hearing on July 6, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant James A. Malitz in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Raabe notes history of case, states they are ready for JT on 5/4/2016.  Matter will remain on for JT on 5/4/2016.

Defendant James A. Malitz in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   State's motion to modify bond.  Atty. Mueller makes argument - cash bond $1500 w/only 3 conditions - modified that bond to $750 cash.  DE has violated bond twice.  Increase bond to $1500.  Atty. Raabe makes argument not reasonable basis and not legal.  DE has been making appearances and that's what bond is for.  Atty. Mueller rebuts.  Atty. Raabe makes a brief statement.  Court denies motion.  Allegations certainly but no new charges.

Defendant James A. Malitz in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant James A. Malitz in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court enters Not Guilty plea- Set for Trial.  Bond continues

Defendant James A. Malitz in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant James A. Malitz in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states appearances.  DE motion for modification of bail/bond.  Court has read motion.  Atty Raabe makes brief argument re: motion.  Requests reduction to $750.00 cash bond.  State responds against modification.  Atty Raabe states DE still has his job when he gets out.  Court grants motion and orders cash bond of $750.00 w/conditions to remain the same as previously ordered w/the addition of:  Not to go to taverns/liquor stores.

Defendant James A. Malitz in court, in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states appearances.  MH set to address the DE's motion to modify bond.  Court questions DE on counsel.  DE states he tried to get an attorney but PD says they can't help because he still has a job if he can get out of jail.  Court will provide the DE with a petition for court-appointed attorney.  State is objecting to the motion and explains why.  Court questions DE on his motion.  DE responds.  Court denies the motion at this time and suggests to DE that he contact DHS as to his child's welfare and submit a  petition for court-appointed counsel.

Defendant James A. Malitz by video from LEC with attorney Puck Tsai.  Defendant James A. Malitz in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  State requests cash bond.  Atty Tsai responds.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $1,500.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety at all times, not to operate MV w/o valid DL and must submit to testing if requested to do so by law enforcement.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Return date scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
